item.title: Provisioning a Raspberry Pi (without an SD Card Reader)
item.description: You may also have faced this issue in the past: you have a Raspberry Pi, and a MicroSD card, but no MicroSD card reader. Well, your Raspberry Pi has one. Why can’t we use that? Well, if you’ve got a Raspberry Pi 3+, you can. Create a recovery / LiveUSB from your host machine Install Raspbian on a USB flash drive. On a Raspberry Pi 3B+, it will automatically boot off of mass storage device, like your Raspbian live USB.
